metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1060 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
python before versions 2.7.15, 3.4.9, 3.5.6rc1, 3.6.5rc1 and 3.7.0 isvulnerable to catastrophic backtracking in pop3lib's apop() method. Anattacker could use this flaw to cause denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.15-4ubuntu1').
